Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can include various types of living things in each habitat drawing, such as trees, grasses, and animals like lizards and squirrels for land habitats, and fish or clams for water habitats.
The student can clearly label or visually distinguish the different types of plants and animals present in each habitat.
The student can show how plants and animals in the drawings are suited to the specific habitat they are in, highlighting diversity.
The student can illustrate patterns within the natural world, such as the presence of similar types of living things in similar environments, to reflect the biodiversity of each habitat.
